data.title: Shadow color doesn't seem to be correct with directional light
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10,  Godot v3

**Issue description:**
Changing spatial material color in respect to directional light doesn't seem to yield correct shading.


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add both a mesh and a directional light to the scene
2. First select a strong red color, shading should appear correct on the mesh. Ensure material is not set to shadeless.
3. Now begin switching to other strong hues.  At this point you should begin to see that the shadow color doesn't appear to be calculating correctly.
![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7462993/27260955-768ed81e-53fe-11e7-94c6-3a4cb0167b18.PNG)
![capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7462993/27260956-78fee7ba-53fe-11e7-8bb9-cf36dfd6d56f.PNG)

data.title: Vector3().snapped() goes wrong with negative numbers
data.body:
Godot Engine 2.13.stable.official win8

Snapping Vector3 returns wrong values when snapping negative values

Little showcase of problem:
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q5LYH9HRsSw&feature=youtu.be](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q5LYH9HRsSw&feature=youtu.be)

data.title: [GDNative] added GDN_EXPORT macro for libraries
data.body:
Up until now there only was GDAPI which was used
for the procedures Godot exposes.

data.title: project manager HiDpi size fix [2.1]
Sky background behaves weirdly in orthogonal viewport mode.
data.body:
**Godot version: 3.0 master**

**Issue description:**
When viewport is in Orthogonal mode. Sky behaves in a way that is unpleasant to read contents of scene.
Biggest problem is when rotated. In side, front looks just like weird sky.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Add procedural sky.
Add cube to scene.
Turn ON Orthogonal mode.
Rotate viewport.

data.title: Cannot export to Mac
data.body:
![mac_export_issue_picture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25082678/27256051-f6dfb1cc-5378-11e7-92dc-f18c207f5d9c.png)
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Ubuntu 16.4 - Daily build from fixnum.org (June 8th and June 17th)


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
You cannot export any project to Mac. There is no option in the drop down and I couldn't find anyway to make a preset through editing the configuration file.

Exporting to Linux and linking custom the custom template to the Mac template doesn't produce a working export.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Open the export menu and look at the available options.

data.title: New Primitives and Collsion Shapes default sizes don't match
data.body:
**Godot version: 3.0 master**


**Issue description:**
If you create Body and assign for example cube shape to it and then add mesh instance with CubePrimitive. Their sizes don't match, collision is two times as big as cube.

In one hand cube size is (1,1,1) which matches units... but is hard to place on grid.
Collision shape is extends are (1,1,1) and is easy to move with snap ON on the grid.
As a user would expect them match by default, although I don't know which size is better.

Needs discussion.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add RigidBody node.
Add CollisionShape to to body.
Add MeshInstance to body.
Assign Cube primitive to MeshInstance node.

Other Collision also don't align. Capsule CollShape is even rotated xD
I think that new primitives sizes and rotations are a bit better because **they use proper Godots Units**.

data.title: SRC_VERTEX is empty in vertex shader
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
KDE neon 5.10 64-bit (GPU: AMD Radeon R9 285/380) - Godot custom build from master on the 16th of June

**Issue description:**
To test this, I made this setup:
![screenshot_20170617_223548](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7459196/27255740-622e9838-53ad-11e7-87dd-ca01f511e9fd.png)
Obviously black is not the expected output.

**Steps to reproduce:**
 Just remake the setup shown above: A sphere with the shown shader applied to it.

[Link to minimal example project](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1082725/GodotTest.tar.gz)

Note that you may encounter another bug: the shader material seems to not be applied upon reloading a project, even though it is set in the properties. Just reapply it for a short term fix (Though an actual fix would be nice :wink:) - Edit: This seems to be related to #9234

data.title: Make generated .h files with some common extension
data.body:
**Issue description:**
As evidenced by #9223, various autogenerated `.h` files are gitignored individually, which leads to some slight issues when switching between branches and the like.

I propose that we make up some more complex extension for them (like `.gen.h`), so that we can ignore them all at once, or even, put them in some special `generated/` folder.

data.title: Fix image lock on preview image generating
data.body: Hides bunch of lock errors while preview image is generating.

data.title: Corrected issue where RGB values not displaying properly between color properties
data.body: Corrects bug reported in #9224

data.title: A way to re-initialise the renderer to apply changed settings without restart
data.body:
A way to re-initialise the renderer to apply changed settings without restart.
Currently, to change the shadow quality one must restart the game. Other options are probably setup like this as well. 
It would be good to be able to reboot systems to apply changes without having to restart the game.

data.title: Potential bug getting tangents and bone weights from meshes
data.body:
Related to PR #9230. I found a lot of the decompression code trying to decompress by taking the value and applying the equation: x * 2 - 1
I had to take this out for vertex colours and normals to mirror how they were being compressed and I think tangents and bone weights will likely also have this problem.
I have no data that uses these so cannot test if this is the case or not.

data.title: Added option to not save a scene when played.
data.body:
Changed the case FILE_SAVE_BEFORE_RUN to use the confirmation dialog instead of
 the accept dialog.
Fixes issue #9232

data.title: No option to *not* save the scene when played
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot `master`, but also applies to 2.1.

**Issue description:**
There isn't a "No" option in the alert that asks you whether to save the scene you try to run it before saving.

![godot windows opt tools 64 3 0_2017-06-16_21-49-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5599796/27248831-73699090-52df-11e7-8883-1fc428bf68d4.png)

Of course, you can just close the alert, but it smells like bad usability for me.

data.title: Fixed a bug in get_pixel not being const
data.body: get_pixel is supposed to be const since nothing gets modified (per reduz)

data.title: Fixed decompression of normals
data.body:
Fixed decompression of normals to reverse how the normals are compressed. 
Fix for issue #8771.

data.title: Allow higher values to be entered then a specified range
data.body:
PROPERTY_HINT_RANGE allows you to set a range between which the value of a property should lie.

Currently that range is applied both to the precision of the slider and the manual entry of values in the property editor which in many cases is exactly what you want.

But there are fields where large values are possible but which results in the slider becoming too imprecise to be usable and you would like to support a lower range for the slider.

The suggestion is to add a new hint that tells the property editor the specified range only applies to the slider and that a lower or higher value can be entered manually. If a value has been entered outside of this range the slider should just show that it is maxed out.

data.title: Fix sliders for primitives
data.body:
This PR fixes the issue with sliders getting stuck (see #9210).
I've also lowered the upper range to 100 on all properties to make the sliders more usable.
Higher values can be set through GDScript if needed but this covers 95% of use cases (I hope).

@akien-mga suggested maybe enhancing the property some day with a hint that allows you to specify higher values then the range can be entered manually. I'll raise a separate issue for that.

data.title: Control.get_pos returns wrong value when automatically moved by parent Container
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7,  Godot Engine v2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**
get_pos() from Control return false value when inside a Container and automatic moved

I expect get_pos() should always return the position of the node (like in node2d). 

In demo project it should be always Vector2(0,0) and a white rectangle should be draw on the same position of the colorFrame.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10463138/27246041-4e6853ac-52ef-11e7-83d3-b4426cdc7862.png)

**Link to minimal example project:**
[getPosBug.zip.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1082036/getPosBug.zip.txt)

data.title: horizontal scrolling bar in script tab broken
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** 
Linux Fedora 25 - v2.1.3.stable.official
Steam version, but started directly

**Issue description:**
When the only very long script line is deleted the horizontal scrolling bar disappears but the start of the line isn't shown.
You have to use your cursor to view the first columns

**Steps to reproduce:**
You scroll at the end of the only long script line then delete it, so all lines could be viewed without a horizontal scrolling bar. The Scrollbar disappears, but you are still viewing the end of the line.

data.title: Fix EditorFileSystem duplicating root folder in new folders
data.body:
Fixes #3662.

Also, add some uninitialized variables into constructors (I like to applease cppcheck).
Also, remove unused `md_count` variable.

P.S. I have no idea how this worked once, but those buggy lines had existed since the "GODOT IS OPEN SOURCE" commit. Unfortunately, this means I can't blame anyone in particular...

P.P.S. This is backportable to 2.1.x I think.

data.title: Color picker fails to update RGB values when selecting different color properties in the Inspector
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Windows 10 - Godot Git https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/bd33fd0435b2d0dc97a7abb3e68b594185f4e6c3


**Issue description:**
The color picker will fail to update the displayed RGB values when selecting different color properties in the Inspector. It always happens when switching colors, and can thus be reproduced in a consistent manner. Clicking the color property again after switching will display the color's RGB values correctly.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Select a node or a resource with at least two color properties, then click on one of the color properties in the inspector. This works fine.

![color_1_working](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/27242992-137f3706-52e0-11e7-9fe3-909524ccaa07.png)

2. Deselect it, and select another color property in the same node or resource. The correct color is displayed, but notice how the RGB values below it are not the correct ones - they are the values of the previously selected color.

![color_2_broken](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/27243012-32d701ec-52e0-11e7-8bae-cdb2d190af2f.png)

3. Click on the second color property again, and the RGB values will display correctly.

![color_2_working](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/27243015-3c9d088e-52e0-11e7-82d5-a232e22dca25.png)

data.title: Prevent Editor from hang when importing stl as mesh
data.body:
When Importing an stl file into Godot from the import mesh menu, the
editor hangs indefinitely. Since only Obj files are supported, the data
remains unparsed and hence the editor enters an infinte loop.

This commit fixes this issue by exiting the loop when godot has finished
parsing the file, irrespective of whether any meaningful data was
extracted out.

Fixes: #9200

data.title: Prevnt Editor from hang when importing stl as mesh . Fixes #9200
Fix scene tab color not updated when theme changed
data.body:
@karroffel reported a issue that scene tab color is not updated properly when theme color is changed.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/9196#issuecomment-309060447

data.title: [3.0] New way of testing InputEvent type via extends failed
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bits Godot 3.0 last fixnum build

**Issue description:**
While trying to convert my project to early version of 3.0, I am erasing the default InputMap then setting up from configfile.
And with new kind of InputEvent not being core type, I have syntax error:
```
105 print("Loading Key binding")
106 	for action in InputMap.get_actions():
107 		for event in InputMap.get_action_list(action):
108 			if (event extends InputEventKey):
109 				InputMap.action_erase_event(action, event) 
```
error(108,14): Expected ')' in expression

data.title: CircleShape2D radius can only increase/decrease in steps of .5
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debian 9 - 3.0

**Issue description:**
When updating the radius of a CircleShape2D from a CollisionShape2D, the radius can only be increased in steps of .5, so you can only have either 1, 1.5 or 2.

No 1.25 or 1.3 and such, and I would like it to be like the scale property where you can have 0.6850.. I know, that amount of decimals is not a needed function, but still.
